name: Pillo Hotel Ashbourne

reviews.text: We found this hotel to be very good value as we got a rate of €100 per room per night including breakfast.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were clean, spacious and modern. The reception etc was also airy and comfortable.
reviews.title: Don't Bother With the Spa

likes.liked: — Spotless, large rooms, fantastic king size bed

reviews.text: The leisure facilities were excellent with a well equiped gym and a lovely pool.
reviews.title: Convenient and clean

likes.liked: — Convenience to home - this was a local night out on our own

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff overall were quite friendly (bar one unhelpful woman at reception).
reviews.title: Fantastic Service !

likes.liked: — The room size and the leisure facilities.
likes.disliked: — Distance from Dublin City but bus services very good.

reviews.text: A great touch was a complementary mini bus into Ashbourne, which also picked us up after dinner.
reviews.title: We loved this hotel!!!

reviews.text: With Dublin hotels being booked out for the Gaelic Football supporters as well as being prohibitively expensive, we sought a place to stay which could accomodate a family of 4 [2 adults and 2 children].
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Asbourne is about 20 - 30 minutes drive to Dublin. The Mariott hotel is situated at the edge of Asbourne and very close to a main road which takes you directly to Dublin.
reviews.title: Loved Marriot Ashbourne

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel which is basically new is very impressive. Check in was efficient. The room was spacious and contained two king size bed. The high quality bedding ensured a good night sleep.
reviews.title: RELAXING STAY, N.Ireland

likes.liked: — The really comfortable beds and the decor was modern and new.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Mariott website had a family special, which enabled the kids [5 and 8] to stay free for 95 euros/ £65, including breakfast! Breakfast was amazing and included smoked salad, cereals along with a full Irish breakfast.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, good for a quick getaway from Dublin!

likes.disliked: — Food choice in the bar was poor and tv channel selection in room is limited

reviews.text: The swimming pool was outstanding. The only cost was 2 euro for a swimming hat. As one can imagine the swimming pool was well received by the children. And even though the purpose of the trip was to see a nephew play for Bohemians FC, the location of the hotel appeared ideal for exploring the northern parts of Ireland. We travelled to Malahide beach and was impressed at the ambience.
reviews.title: Luxury,relaxation,nice food and drink.

likes.liked: — quiet localition. Leisure area disabled friend if needed
likes.disliked: — having to wear a hat in pool area(but appreciate why)

reviews.text: My stay was great.hotel staff were very friendly esp barry the porter.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.text: the bar and restaurant were very modern but the food was terrible. badly cooked probably frozen. The room were very good quite spacious and very clean. The pool and gym were very good too.
reviews.title: Great Weekend!

likes.disliked: — Didn't take special requests into consideration

reviews.text: i reccommend anyone too stay. but i advice you bring a packed lunch.
reviews.title: Business trip in Marriott Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked the Marriot as a treat for my boyfriend's birthday and a small group of close friends stayed also.
reviews.title: Highly recommended
loved it
reviews.text: The room was lovely, had requested a king size bed but was given two doubles. Luckily they were big enough to fit us both into one! The facilities at the hotel were the best I have ever used! The gym was huge and there was a wide range of treatments on offer at the spa beauty centre.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for one night, Got a rate of 125 euros for myself and my partner, which included breakfast. The directions on the hotel website were easy to follow. On arrival I was surprised how modern the hotel looked. I had spoken to Marion in reservations and she was very pleasant in reserving our room. A lady called Susan welcomed us in reception, and was most helpful. We were close to Blanchardstown shopping centre and spent time shopping. The hotel has a pool and leisure centre, unfortunately we didnot have time to use it. The room we had was on the fifth floor and was absolutely gergeous, it was sparkling clean and we were very pleased with it. later that evening we dined in the red bar, although quite contempary I liked it. The food was really good, as I myself work in the hospitality industry and I appreciated the effort gone into our food, I had the fish in a beer batter and my other half had roast chicken with champ and roasted vegetables which were delicious. The only down side of the red bar was the service, not with the food but with the drink. the waiteress in behind the bar left me there for ten mins and did not even give me eye contact. Eventually I called her. The breakfast the next morning was good, and the service was excellent. Upon checking out I mentioned to the receptionist that the service for drink was very slow, she profusely apologised and said that they had some temporary staff employed for the season. I would accept that comment. Overall the next time I visit I will make an appointment for the spa which was booked out. Well done ashbourne marriott, I will return.
reviews.title: Relaxing Break

likes.liked: — The room and the most comforable bed I ever slept in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: really nice architectural piece of work. but the inside does not reflect the outside.
reviews.title: needs some work

likes.liked: — i loved the rooms and the locality of the hotel

reviews.text: the room was very nice although im lucky i dont watch too much tv.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel but poor service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: my check in was very efficient and welcoming.
reviews.title: Modern Hotel but Food is inedible

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the service in the restaurant was very quick and efficient but the food was terrible.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but eat elsewhere.

description: This modern hotel combines contemporary chic with 4 star luxury, perfectly located between Dublin City centre and Meath the heritage capital of Ireland so you can enjoy the best of both worlds. With 148 bedrooms decorated to the highest standard The Pillo Hotel Ashbourne is the only choice when staying for business or pleasure.The Pillo Hotel Ashbourne is ideal for a family getaway, with interconnecting and spacious family rooms available, a fantastic 16 metre swimming pool, children’s play room on site and with Ireland’s newest attraction Tayto Park just five minutes away the children will be entertained for hours. Other attractions within the area include The National Aquatic Centre, Dublin Zoo and Funtasia.Or if you’re staying for business, enjoy our high speed complimentary internet access or work in the comfort of our business centre. Relax and unwind in our Fitness centre, Jacuzzi, steam room or sauna.The Pillo Hotel Ashbourne is located on the N2 and is only 11 minutes from the M50, which makes the hotel the perfect location for conferences and events partnered with over 9000 square feet of meeting space over 7 meeting rooms and on site exhibition space.
